channel.title: Comments on: My top ten favorite technologies of this decade.
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Cindy
item.dc:creator: Cindy
item.content:encoded:
My top three are-(not sure that I have ten!)
Smartphones
E-book readers
Wireless broadband

So many new gadgets coming out all the time-I am a gadget geek so to speak and an reading nut! Can’t live without my Kindle!

item.title: By: ThatRickGuy
item.dc:creator: ThatRickGuy
item.content:encoded:
Don’t forget Silverlight ðŸ™‚ Finally some competition for Flash, AND it’s proving to be an awesome tool for rich web apps.

-Rick

item.title: By: David Forck (thirster42)
item.dc:creator: David Forck (thirster42)
item.content:encoded:
Denis:
>>>>LCDs
>>I would go for OLED instead
yeah, but LCDs are the ones that replaced most crt monitors.

>>>>Firefox
>>I like Chrome
I picked firefox because it somewhat helped spark the web standards fight that’s going on.

>>>>Microsoft SQL Server 2005
>>Prefer 2008 for compression (backup, row and page) and date data types
Mainly picked 2005 because that’s what i have to most experience with.

>>>>Windows XP
>>Win 7 IMHO
I pick windows xp over windows 7 because xp has been the predominant os for the aughts. Windows 7 has just came out and hasn’t gotten to it full potential and use yet.

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.description: If we mention Silverlight then we also need to mention JavaFX, Adobe Air and of course HTML 5
item.content:encoded: If we mention Silverlight then we also need to mention JavaFX, Adobe Air and of course HTML 5

item.title: By: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.dc:creator: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.description: Well, we would need to add Silverlight then.
item.content:encoded: Well, we would need to add Silverlight then.

item.title: By: Alex Ullrich
item.dc:creator: Alex Ullrich
item.description: Ajax is a good one - so good that its almost taken for granted at this point.
item.content:encoded: Ajax is a good one – so good that its almost taken for granted at this point.

item.title: By: Ted Krueger (onpnt)

item.content:encoded:
You forgot Oracle!

PWHAHAHAHA!!! Ok, in what decade was Oracle a favorite technology of any sorts ðŸ˜›

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.description: Mmmmm..I forgot to mention RSS, Podcasting and HD video on Cameras like the Canon EOS 5D Mark II
item.content:encoded: Mmmmm..I forgot to mention RSS, Podcasting and HD video on Cameras like the Canon EOS 5D Mark II

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.content:encoded:
Alex..since we are talking programming here are some things

Rails/Django/MVC..web frameworks

Functional languages like F#, Haskell, Erlang, Scala and Clojure

ORM like Hibernate/nHibernate

Ajax
Although people think Ajax was invented by Google in GMail it already existed in 2001 if you used OWA (Outlook Web Access) you would have seen this already

Javascript libraries like jQuery, ExtJS, ProtoType, Dojo and others

Languages running on to of the JVM/CLR
Things like Jython/Iron Python IronRuby/JRuby Scala F# etc etc
